page.title: 20 Transport - Roads
page.content: Eastham is well served by its road system.The{A41}is the main road linking Liverpool and Chester;and the M.53,which starts at Wallasey and finishes at Chester,links with the A41 at junction 5.This motorway has three lanes and a hard shoulder.Private cars,buses and lorries travel along i The{M.53}joins onto the M.56 which goes to Manchester,Warrington and Runcorn. The M.56 then links with the {M.62,}which is the trans-Pennine motorway,and the M6 which travels to the North and South of the country. In the 1960's there was much much concern in Eastham at the number of oil tankers passing through the village.As a result a by-pass was built and the tankers now leave the motorway just past junction 5 and avoid the village.
